requirements:
Basic To-Do List Website named Knox, Requirements
User Interface:

Simple input field to add new tasks quickly.

List display area showing tasks clearly.

Checkboxes or toggles to mark tasks as completed.

Edit and delete options for existing tasks.

Responsive design for use on both desktop and mobile devices.

Task Management:

Ability to add, edit, and delete tasks.

Mark tasks as complete or incomplete.

Option to prioritize or categorize tasks.

Save tasks persistently (local storage or backend database).

User Experience:

Clear visual differentiation between completed and pending tasks.

Easy navigation and intuitive controls.

Option to reorder tasks by drag and drop or priority.

Technical Requirements:

Responsive front-end using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.

Optional backend for user authentication and task storage (using database).

Cross-browser compatibility.

Performance optimized for fast load and smooth interactions.

state.requirements:
Basic To-Do List Website named Knox, Requirements
User Interface:

Simple input field to add new tasks quickly.

List display area showing tasks clearly.

Checkboxes or toggles to mark tasks as completed.

Edit and delete options for existing tasks.

Responsive design for use on both desktop and mobile devices.

Task Management:

Ability to add, edit, and delete tasks.

Mark tasks as complete or incomplete.

Option to prioritize or categorize tasks.

Save tasks persistently (local storage or backend database).

User Experience:

Clear visual differentiation between completed and pending tasks.

Easy navigation and intuitive controls.

Option to reorder tasks by drag and drop or priority.

Technical Requirements:

Responsive front-end using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.

Optional backend for user authentication and task storage (using database).

Cross-browser compatibility.

Performance optimized for fast load and smooth interactions.

functional_requirements.description: Users can add new tasks to their to-do list.
acceptance_criteria: User can type a task description into an input field.
Pressing 'Enter' or clicking an 'Add' button adds the new task to the list.
The input field is cleared after a task is added.
All tasks are displayed in a list format.
Each task in the list shows its description.
Completed tasks are visually distinct from pending tasks (e.g., strikethrough text).

functional_requirements.description: Users can mark tasks as complete or incomplete.
acceptance_criteria: Each task has a checkbox or a toggle button.
Clicking the checkbox marks the task as complete.
Clicking it again marks the task as incomplete.

functional_requirements.description: Users can edit the description of an existing task.
acceptance_criteria: Clicking 'Edit' makes the task description editable in-place.
Saving the changes updates the task description in the list.

functional_requirements.description: Users can delete tasks from the list.
acceptance_criteria: Clicking 'Delete' prompts the user for confirmation.
Upon confirmation, the task is permanently removed from the list.

functional_requirements.description: Tasks are saved in the browser's local storage.
acceptance_criteria: Tasks persist in the browser even after the page is reloaded or the browser is closed.
All additions, edits, deletions, and status changes are saved automatically.
Users can drag and drop tasks to change their order in the list.
The new order is saved and persists after a page reload.

non_functional_requirements.description: The application should load quickly and respond to user interactions without noticeable delay.
The user interface must be intuitive and easy to use for non-technical users.
metrics: A new user can add and complete a task in under 30 seconds without instructions.
All interactive elements have clear visual feedback (e.g., hover states, click effects).

non_functional_requirements.description: The application layout must adapt to different screen sizes, providing a good user experience on both desktop and mobile devices.
metrics: The application is fully functional and readable on screen widths from 320px to 1920px.
No horizontal scrolling is required on mobile devices.

non_functional_requirements.description: The application must function correctly on the latest versions of major web browsers.
metrics: Full functionality on the latest two versions of Chrome, Firefox, Safari, and Edge.

non_functional_requirements.description: User's task data should not be lost or corrupted during normal use.
metrics: Tasks saved in local storage are correctly retrieved on subsequent visits.

frontend: CSS3 (or a utility-first framework like Tailwind CSS)

risks: Scope Creep: Requests for additional features like user accounts, cloud sync, or due dates could expand the project beyond the initial low-complexity scope.
Data Loss: Since data is stored in local storage, users can lose their data if they clear their browser cache. This limitation should be communicated.
UI/UX Challenges: Achieving a truly intuitive drag-and-drop and editing experience can be more time-consuming than anticipated.
assumptions: The initial version will use browser Local Storage for data persistence, as a backend is optional.
User authentication and multi-user support are out of scope for this version.
The design will be minimalistic and functional, focusing on core features rather than complex UI/UX elements.
Cross-browser compatibility targets the latest versions of major browsers (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge).

state.message: Requirements analysis complete. Awaiting human review.
